84_121123_000056_000004.original_text: The doctor of the dead then laid his permit on the corner of the table, and having fulfilled his duty, was conducted out by d'Avrigny.
84_121123_000056_000004.normalized_text: The doctor of the dead then laid his permit on the corner of the table, and having fulfilled his duty, was conducted out by d'Avrigny.

84_121550_000024_000000.original_text: Thou makest me remember where and what Proserpina that moment was when lost Her mother her, and she herself the Spring."
84_121550_000024_000000.normalized_text: Thou makest me remember where and what Proserpina that moment was when lost Her mother her, and she herself the Spring."

84_121123_000011_000007.original_text: Tell them--oh, tell them, that corpse belongs to me!"
84_121123_000011_000007.normalized_text: Tell them-oh, tell them, that corpse belongs to me!"

84_121123_000010_000000.original_text: Villefort drew back and looked with astonishment on the young man, who, almost a stranger to him, called Noirtier his father.
84_121123_000010_000000.normalized_text: Villefort drew back and looked with astonishment on the young man, who, almost a stranger to him, called Noirtier his father.

84_121550_000207_000000.original_text: In grace do us the grace that thou unveil Thy face to him, so that he may discern The second beauty which thou dost conceal."
84_121550_000207_000000.normalized_text: In grace do us the grace that thou unveil Thy face to him, so that he may discern The second beauty which thou dost conceal."

84_121550_000143_000000.original_text: But when I heard in their sweet melodies Compassion for me, more than had they said, "O wherefore, lady, dost thou thus upbraid him?"
84_121550_000143_000000.normalized_text: But when I heard in their sweet melodies Compassion for me, more than had they said, "O wherefore, lady, dost thou thus upbraid him?"

84_121550_000167_000000.original_text: Even as a cross-bow breaks, when 'tis discharged Too tensely drawn the bowstring and the bow, And with less force the arrow hits the mark,
84_121550_000167_000000.normalized_text: Even as a cross bow breaks, when 'tis discharged Too tensely drawn the bowstring and the bow, And with less force the arrow hits the mark,

84_121550_000243_000000.original_text: Alone she sat upon the very earth, Left there as guardian of the chariot Which I had seen the biform monster fasten.
84_121550_000243_000000.normalized_text: Alone she sat upon the very earth, Left there as guardian of the chariot Which I had seen the biform monster fasten.

84_121550_000268_000000.original_text: And Beatrice, compassionate and sighing, Listened to them with such a countenance, That scarce more changed was Mary at the cross.
84_121550_000268_000000.normalized_text: And Beatrice, compassionate and sighing, Listened to them with such a countenance, That scarce more changed was Mary at the cross.

84_121123_000028_000000.original_text: "And will you direct us?" exclaimed the young man.
84_121123_000028_000000.normalized_text: "And will you direct us?" exclaimed the young man.

84_121550_000062_000000.original_text: Between her steps and mine were not a hundred, When equally the margins gave a turn, In such a way, that to the East I faced.
84_121550_000062_000000.normalized_text: Between her steps and mine were not a hundred, When equally the margins gave a turn, In such a way, that to the East I faced.

84_121550_000203_000000.original_text: Think, Reader, if within myself I marvelled, When I beheld the thing itself stand still, And in its image it transformed itself.
84_121550_000203_000000.normalized_text: Think, Reader, if within myself I marvelled, When I beheld the thing itself stand still, And in its image it transformed itself.

84_121550_000191_000000.original_text: Such self-conviction stung me at the heart O'erpowered I fell, and what I then became She knoweth who had furnished me the cause.
84_121550_000191_000000.normalized_text: Such self conviction stung me at the heart O'erpowered I fell, and what I then became She knoweth who had furnished me the cause.

84_121550_000173_000000.original_text: Weeping I said: "The things that present were With their false pleasure turned aside my steps, Soon as your countenance concealed itself."
84_121550_000173_000000.normalized_text: Weeping I said: "The things that present were With their false pleasure turned aside my steps, Soon as your countenance concealed itself."
